description.narrative:
DRC/ DDG has applied to Sida for funding of 45 million SEK to carry out the " Community-Driven Recovery and Safety Programme in Somalia'' during the period 1 November 2014 to 31 December 2016.
The intervention aims at contributing to the stabilization of fragile parts of Somalia by strengthening social justice through improved community level governance mechanisms and enhancing access to employment opportunities, social services and security for conflict affected populations.
The implementation of the CDRS programme will be done through five different processes: i) Community Block grants and Social Services Access Grants ii) Community safety related activities (delivered by DDG under its Community Safety programme) iii) Conflict prevention and management activities iv) Livelihood interventions.
The intervention will focus ob two 'regions' and a subsequent number of districts in Somalia. Pre-CDRS will be implemented in Warsheikh distrit in Middle Shabelle region followed by CDRS in 20 communities. CDRS will target 40 communities in the Bay/Bakol/Gedo region. Out of these, 20 communities will be in Luug district, Gedo region and the remaining 20 communities will be in Baidoa, Bay Bakol region.
DRC/DDG will implement the CDRS programme alongside the Community Project Implementation Units (CPIUs) from the targeted communities.
The intervention’s total budget is 45 million SEK, all of which will be funded by Sida.

Insatsen syftar till att stabilisera utsatta delar av Somalia där stärkt social rättvisa stöds genom att stärka lokalsamhällens styrelse och administration och stöd till jobbskapande, förbättrad samhällsservice och ökad säkerhet för lokalbefolkningen. CDRS-programmet implementeras genom de följande fem komponenterna: i) Bidrag till lokalsamhällen för infrastrukturprojekt ii) Bidrag för ökad tillgång till samhällstjänster iii) Säkerhetsrelaterade aktiviteter (implementerat av DDG) iv) Förebyggande och hantering av konflikter v) Jobbskapande insatser Programmet fokuserar på tre regioner i Somalia, där totalt 60 ”lokalsamhällen” (communities) stöds i tre distrikt. I Warsheikh, Mellersta Shabelle, kommer DRC/DDG att implementera en pre-CDRS följt av det ullfjädrade programmet i 20 lokalsamhällen. I Luug, Gedo-regionen, och i Baidoa, Bay-regionen, stödjer programmet 20 lokalsamhällen i vardera distriktet.

To contribute to the stabilization of fragile parts of Somalia by strengthening social justice through improved community level governance mechanisms and enhancing access to employment opportunities, social services and security for conflict affected populations.

description.narrative: The Community Driven Recovery and Safety (CDRS) was a 2 year programme with the aim of enhancing the stability of communities in Somalia. The project was a joint initiative of Danish Demining Group (DDG) and Danish Refugee Council (DRC) who have several years-experience working in conflict affected areas, and in Somalia specifically. The overall objective is to contribute to the stabilization of fragile parts of Somalia by strengthening social justice through improved community level governance mechanisms and enhancing access to employment opportunities, social services and security for conflict affected populations. The CDRS project was implemented in 60 communities in 3 districts of Somalia which were Warsheikh District in Middle Shabelle Region, Luuq District in Gedo Region, and Baidoa District in Bay Region. During the project duration from 1 Nov 2014 to 28 Feb 2017, the following were the main results achieved: Objective 1: - Community Empowerment: 60 communities in South-Central Somalia take control over and freely exercising their right to decide on the design, implementation and evaluation of their own development and safety plans. Summary of achievements under objective 1 -All 60 communities in the 3 districts developed and finalized Community Recovery and Safety (CRS) plans. CRS plans were approved by community residents during wider meetings and were endorsed by the District Commissioner (DC);-All 60 community established Project Implementation Units (CPIUs). CPIUs held monthly community meetings on regular basis. At least 1/3 of representatives in the Community Committee are women;-100% of the 60 CDRS supported communities were able to self-implement at least one of their prioritized needs from the community plans;-33% of women actively participated in the prioritization and development of the Community Safety and Development Plans where. At least 2 priorities of CDRS supported communities were linked back to needs of women in the communities. About 51.75% of women in the targeted 60 communities directly or indirectly benefited from the CDRS intervention;-100% of 61 sub-projects funded by the grants are operational after their completion in October 2016 and 5 additional community peace and security priorities implemented in Luuq, Warsheekh and Baidoa. Objective 2 - Bottom Up Governance: Local governance structures in three districts in South Central Somalia are reinforced to be more responsive and accountable to community needsSummary of achievements under objective 2-CPIUs, VCs and District met on a regular basis. All action points from the discussions and meeting minutes agreed by the stakeholders were recorded;-75% action points agreed between village council and local government has been completed with support by district, regional and/or central governments;-50% positive variation of respondents in CDRS-supported communities that are more aware of the activities and responsibilities of the local government than respondents from non-CDRS supported communities. Objective 3 - Conflict prevention and management: Traditional systems with additional community involvement are able to identify and address underlying causes of conflict and to manage potential conflicts in a peaceful mannerSummary of achievements under objective 3 -Peace building and functional conflict resolution structures have been established and 125 representatives have been formulated and reconstituted from all community segments from the 60 communities (including elders, youths and women groups) in the three districts.-The peace-building committees (Gurti) have been trained on conflict resolution techniques, conflict analysis, Conflict Prevention, Management and Reconciliation (CPMR) and peace leadership in Warsheikh and Luuq districts.-Community dialogue and reconciliation plans developed in Luuq and Warsheikh-Trauma healing and reconciliation training have been conducted in Luuq and Warsheikh-Gurti committees have facilitated peace caravans and disseminated xeer and conflict resolution 500 booklets for Luuq and Warsheikh communities.-Monthly peace meetings have been conducted in December 2016, January and February 2017 Objective 4 - Socioeconomic and security services: Improved access to social and economic infrastructures and services, employment opportunities, security provision for the population of communities in Somalia.Summary of achievements under objective 4 - Pre-CDRS project has been implemented in Warsheikh as a rapid assessment response. After a joint rapid assessment in Warsheikh District, district level discussions attended by village councils, security measures became a first priority and establishment of police unit was proposed and implemented.-Every community prioritized and developed their safety and development recovery priority needs (3 safety and 3 development priorities). At least one of the 3 safety and 3 development priorities that were identified by each community during planning process was addressed through a funded sub-project.-61 sub-projects have been completed in the 60 target communities; 100% of the sub-projects are operational at time of reporting-60 block grants benefitted 226,584 individuals, whereas the Social services Access Grant (SAG) benefited 803 most vulnerable persons from among 60 targeted communities. 439 of selected SAG beneficiaries were most needy women.-36,592 workdays created in CDRS and livelihood supported communities as result of construction and rehabilitation of infrastructure.-Under the livelihood components, 786 individuals and their families directly benefited from Vocational Skill Training (VST), Cash for Work (CFW), Small and Medium Enterprises (SME) and agro-support activities.-50% of community members in CDRS supported communities report improved responsiveness of security providers to complaints;-Each of supported communities reported instances where security providers and community members cooperated to achieve a common goal; Objective 5 - Safety: Improved community safety in relation to risk management with firearms & Explosive Remnants of War (ERW) and improved conflict management skills for individualsSummary of achievements under objective 5 -14 CDRS field staff have been trained on the facilitation of community-police dialogues;-Assessments were conducted in the 3 districts to understand the relationship between stakeholders and rebuild relationship between 60 targeted communities and security providers including community segments, police, elders and government officials;-Separate preparatory meetings and joint community police forums have been conducted in the 3 districts;-Community police training workshops were conducted in the 3 districts;-Security providers and 60 targeted communities conducted community police planning sessions and identified two common goals per district in the project locations where 2 police units have been established in Baidoa, Luuq police station has been rehabilitated and Warsheikh Police post has been operationalized;-Community police committees established through participatory process and functionalized.
